direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In One step, the middle element rotates through 180oand in the next step, the other two elements rotate through 180o. The two steps are repeated alternately.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: Similar figure appears alternately and each time a figure reappears, all the elements move one step CW.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The central arrow rotates 90oACW and 45oCW alternately. The half-arrow moves half-a-side of the square boundary in a CW direction and its head turns to the other side of the line in each step.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: Both the larger and the smaller squares move to the adjacent corner ACW in each turn. Also, the shading in the smaller square moves 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, ... steps ACW sequentially and the shading in the larger square moves 1, 2, 3, 4, 5,.... steps CW sequentially.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 5 - 7)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The symbols move in the sequencesandalternately.

Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.

answer_description: The symbols move in the sequencesandalternately.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 5 - 7)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The line segment rotates through 90oand moves to the adjacent portion of the rhombus in an ACW direction in first, third, fifth, ... steps. The other symbol moves to the adjacent portion of the rhombus in an ACW direction and also gets replaced by a new symbol in second, fourth, sixth,... steps.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 8 - 11)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The figure rotates through 180o.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 8 - 11)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The upper element is converted to an element similar to the lower elements and each one of the lower elements is converted to an element similar to the upper element.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 8 - 11)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The elements move downwards along the diagonal and the lowermost element moves to the uppermost position. The triangle and the half shaded rectangle get vertically inverted and the pentagon rotates 90oCW.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 8 - 11)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The existing line segments that join the corners of the squares move to the adjacent corners in an ACW direction and one more line segment appears in the next corner at the ACW-end. The shading inside the innermost square changes from dots to slanting lines.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 12 - 16)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. answer_description: The two partially shaded circles rotate through 180o.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 12 - 16)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. answer_description: The upper part of the figure gets separated along the line and is lost.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 12 - 16)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The outer element divides into two equal parts; the lower half is lost; the upper part gets shaded and moves to the lower position. The inner element reduces in size; rotates through 45o; gets unshaded and reaches the upper position.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 12 - 16)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The outer element divides into two parts along the horizontal line of symmetry and the two parts get vertically inverted. The inner element gets rotated through 90o.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 12 - 16)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The set of three pins gets vertically inverted and moves to the lower-right position; the triangle rotates 90oACW; the third element rotates 45oACW and moves to the upper-left position. The dot in this element moves to the adjacent portion in a CW direction.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 17 - 20)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The two dots lie on the same side of the diagonal only in fig. (4).

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 17 - 20)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: Each one of the remaining figures is composed of straight lines only.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 17 - 20)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: Except fig. (4), in all other figures, one of the two arrows points towards the centre of the circle.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 17 - 20)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In all other figures, both the arrowheads lie towards the diameter of the semicircle.
